newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE sugar ends firm, conditions busy.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE sugar ends firm, conditions busy.

text.p: White sugar futures remained firmer during Wednesday evening LIFFE trading, finishing higher after an active session.
Traders said the strength in London reflected technical gains in New York, where March raws broke through the previous high and touched off fund buy stops.
Activity again centred around the approaching expiry of the spot March contract as players rolled positions forward and continued to post large volumes of against actuals trades.
Because of this, London turnover was at its highest since last April when volume was 6,104 lots.
March ended up $3.50 at $303.10 after peaking at $303.60. May was up $2.90 at $301.10.
Technically, March moved back above the key $300 barrier, following an upward trendline in place since the contract hit a trough of $293.30 in late January.
The position has now pushed through all its short-term moving averages. Momentum indicators have turned higher while remaining in positive territory.
In physical news, Iran's Government Trading Corporation (GTC) tendered to buy 14,000 tonnes of white sugar for April delivery.
Permitted origins are the European Union (excluding the U.K.), Thailand and Brazil.
